data.text:
My experience
in Cambodia
Pastor Supervisor Domingo Carlos

data.title:
Apostolic Church Fountain of Truth Cambodia

Missionary Trip Report and Urgent Needs
data.content:
Thank God, the missionary trip to Cambodia was realized in the month of January 2023!

The church of Cambodia continues to be brave, with tenacity, will, and perseverance despite the many challenges and adversities. We ask for prayers for the pastors, their families, and the brethren so they can continue advancing, traversing, and navigating through all storms. That way they can continue to grow, expand, and reach more territory.

Currently there are 4 churches:
      Siem Reap (Pastor Ratheany Ung)
      Toulaviang (Pastor Pheak Tra Teav)
      Phnom Toich (Minister (E) Theb Yan)
      Kampot (Pastor Chiyat Pen)
Last month’s missionary trip was marvelous and of great success. Throughout the days of ministries:
  • Three villages were visited, where all the believers got together and the gospel was preached to the new listeners.
  • There was a conference for all the Cambodian leaders, one conference for all the pastors and their wives, and one conference for the women that was of great healing and empowerment.
  • There was a great celebration where all the believers from the city of Siem Reap, Kampot, and six other villages got together for it (almost 500 people were in assistance). It was a beautiful and powerful service full of healing, of the Holy Spirit, and of new souls receiving the gospel.
  • 11 People were baptized.
We are grateful for the executive team (Samuel Valverde, Raquel Valverde, Domingo Carlos, Timothy Valverde, Nat Ochoa, and Patrick Cisneros) for their leadership in realizing this vision for this trip. We are also thankful for the whole team that traveled from FTC Rancho, FTC Tijuana, FTC San Diego, FTC Dallas/Ft. Worth, and FTC Phoenix for their great collaboration in creating this great impact for FTC Cambodia.

Stay Tuned for the announcement of the missionary trip to Cambodia, since we have plans to go back with a robust group. So that way the church of Cambodia can keep on being propelled to impact and transform the lives of everyone that joins this group.

There were many churches and people that donated, more than we can name, this is what was donated:
  • Backpacks and school utensils for more than 100 kids
  • Backpacks to all the cambodian leaders (40)
  • Fanny packs to 60 women
  • Fed 500 people after the great celebration
  • Bought furniture, accessories, tables, instruments, and utensils in general for the new temple
We give all the glory to God because we were able to dedicate the temple for the church of Siem Reap!

After the efforts that started in November of 2018, in which we went through many challenges due to the pandemic and other construction obstacles, we thank God that we were able to construct a temple with a pastoral house in our own property of Fountain of Truth Cambodia in the city of Siem Reap. This building will be a place of prayer, worship, ministerial capacitation, school of music, school to learn English, and for community outreach. We thank the company of Carlosendo Laparoscopic Instruments (from Ismael and Domingo Carlos) and to FTC Rancho Cucamonga, which were the primary givers in supplying the $68K that were invested to complete this project.

The mortgage of $20,000 still needs to be paid so that way we can eliminate the debt of this project. Other national necessities include:
  • 4 motorcycles for the pastors, so that they can continue their ministry throughout the villages
  • 1 Van for the principal church
  • 2 sound systems for two of the four churches
  • Walls and flooring for the temple of one of the villages (Toualaviang)
Lastly, we ask for special prayers directed towards the wife of the pastor of Siem Reap (Keany “Esther” Teav) and the wife of the pastor of Kampot (Tooch “Tabita” Neal). We are asking for prayer due to the fact that both of these women are going through serious illnesses and need a miracle of healing in their bodies.

Report delivered by: Pastor Domingo Carlos, FTC Supervisor Cambodia
